name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-001 Bulk Earthworks & Checklist - Rev.3
template name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-001 Bulk Earthworks & Checklist - Rev.3

name: Ref docs - Issued drawings / Site copy drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Check that you have the latest site and engineering drawings BEFORE starting each task/set of tasks.
Acceptance Criteria - Prepare a lot map for traceability of the work area
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Lot map
Acceptance Criteria - Has the work area been set out as per the drawings?
Acceptance Criteria - Approval to use any stockpile sites not shown on drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that excavated material is separated as follows:
Acceptance Criteria - Fill Material to be free of roots, clay, topsoil, steel and organic material. Use primarily Site-won cuttings and supplement with imported material if necessary.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Material Test Reports
Ref docs - Spec. 1102 Control of erosion and sedimentation [Cl 3.7]
Acceptance Criteria - Where necessary, have batters been rounded and catch drains constructed to allow for potential surface runoff during the course of excavation?
Is the area in cut / fill / both?
If in cut proceed to step 2.0 and strike out section 3.0.
If in fill please strike out section 2.0 and proceed to section 3.0
If in both proceed to step 2.0 as well as section 3.0
Acceptance Criteria - Has the cut surface been trimmed to an even surface free from lose material and within tolerance of +/- 50mm from design floor level?
Acceptance Criteria - Any Unsuitable material to be removed as directed by the superintendent
Acceptance Criteria - Floor of excavation to be inspected to determine sufficient depth of unsuitable material has been removed
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to ripping, test the CBR of the material in the cut floor to ensure it is > 3%
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
2.5 - Ripping Cut Floor (Not required if foundation is in stabilised remediation pad)
Acceptance Criteria - Has the floor of cuttings been adequately ripped to a min. depth of 200mm?
○ The max. dimension for any particles in the ripped or loosened zone not to exceed 150mm.
○ Ripped material to be presented for inspection.
Acceptance Criteria - Re-compact the ripped floor to achieving a relative compaction of 97%
○ If unsuitable replacement has occurred, compact the replacement layers to 92% and the design cutting floor to 97%
Notice: Prior to placing subsequent layers
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
2.7 - Proof Roll – Subgrade (Not required if foundation is in stabilised remediation pad)
Acceptance Criteria - Does the layer withstand proof rolling without visible deformation or springing?
Notice: 2 working days before next activity
3.1 - Foundation Preparation (Not required if foundation is in stabilised remediation pad)
Acceptance Criteria - Grade and level the area, adjust the moisture content and compact the top 200mm to 97% relative compaction
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
Acceptance Criteria - Embankment foundation to be inspected by the superintendent. Any Unsuitable material to be removed as directed.
Notice: 1 working day before next activity
Acceptance Criteria - Floor of excavation to be inspected to determine sufficient depth of unsuitable material has been removed
3.4 - Proof Roll – Subgrade (Not required if foundation is in stabilised remediation pad)
Acceptance Criteria - Does the layer withstand proof rolling without visible deformation or springing?
Notice: 2 working days before next activity
Acceptance Criteria - Has fill been placed in maximum 200mm compacted layer thickness?
(Approval required to increase compacted later thickness to 300mm)
Note: Maximum fill layer thickness adjacent to structures 150mm)
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Delivery dockets (if imported)
Acceptance Criteria - Is the moisture content within the range of 60% to 90% of optimum moisture content for all fill layers
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
Ref docs - Spec. 1112 Earthworks (Roadways) [Cl 4.13, 7.1], Spec. 0161 Quality (Construction) [Cl 7.2]
Acceptance Criteria - Compact any material used for unsuitable replacement, general fill (>1.5m deep), verges and medians to a relative compaction > 92%
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
Ref docs - Spec. 1112 Earthworks (Roadways) [Cl 4.13, 7.1], Spec. 0161 Quality (Construction) [Cl 7.2]
Acceptance Criteria - Compact any material used for shallow embankments, Select Fill or behind kerbs to a relative compaction > 97%
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
Acceptance Criteria - Compact all material adjacent to structures to achieve a relative compaction of 92% (up to 1.5m from top of pavement) or 97% (within 1.5m of top of pavement)?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill material granular and not exceeding 50mm particle size
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Test reports
3.11 - Proof Roll / Select Material Zone Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - After trimming & compaction, present the top layer of SMZ for inspection.
○ Does the layer withstand proof rolling without visible deformation or springing?
Notice: 2 working days before next activity
Acceptance Criteria - Provide batter slopes as shown on the drawings. Clean the cut faces of any loose or unstable batters as the excavation proceeds
Acceptance Criteria - Excavate a terrace as per the figure in Cl 4.5 for the width of the SMZ to a depth of 900mm below the cutting floor
Notice: 1 working days before excavating terrace
Acceptance Criteria - Has the pavement been constructed at the correct width and alignment as detailed in the construction drawings?
Acceptance Criteria - Trimmed top of embankment to be within the range -40mm to +10mm from design levels
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - As built report
